text: NMDP Values publicly available privacy reasons. Please contact co-Author Martin Maiers inquiries.

title: Test Roy 2025 Figures and tables
text: ’ve downloaded requisite source information package’s instructions, can build package re-create Figures Tables published Roy2025 vignette provided enable anyone see source data methodology behind publication.

title: Test Roy 2025 Figures and tables
code: state_frequencies <- CensusHLA::census_adjusted_nmdp_hla_frequencies_by_state |> dplyr::filter(allele == 'A*11:01')  out_data <- state_frequencies |>   dplyr::ungroup() |>   dplyr::group_by(region, census_region, fips) |>   dplyr::summarize(gf = sum(us_2020_nmdp_gf)) `summarise()` has grouped output by 'region', 'census_region'. You can override using the `.groups` argument. gg_state <- usmap::plot_usmap(   data = out_data,   regions = "states",   #exclude = c('Alaksa','Hawaii'),   exclude = c('AK', 'HI'),   values = "gf",   color = "black",   linewidth = 0.1 ) +   viridis::scale_fill_viridis(option = "plasma", direction = 1) gg_state out_data |>    dplyr::mutate(gf = round(gf,4)) |>    dplyr::rename(     `State` = region,     `Census Region` = census_region,     `FIPS` = fips,     `Population-Adjusted Genotypic Frequency` = gf   ) |>   DT::datatable(     ,filter = 'top'     ,rownames = FALSE     ,extensions = 'Buttons', options = list(       scrollX=TRUE,       pageLength = 10,       dom = 'Bfrtip',       buttons = c('csv', 'excel')       )     )

title: Test Roy 2025 Figures and tables
code: state_frequencies <- CensusHLA::census_adjusted_nmdp_hla_frequencies_by_state |> dplyr::filter(allele == 'A*11:01')  out_data <- state_frequencies |>   dplyr::ungroup() |>   dplyr::group_by(region, census_region, fips) |>   dplyr::summarize(gf = sum(us_2020_nmdp_gf)) `summarise()` has grouped output by 'region', 'census_region'. You can override using the `.groups` argument. gg_state <- usmap::plot_usmap(   data = out_data,   regions = "states",   #exclude = c('Alaksa','Hawaii'),   exclude = c('AK', 'HI'),   values = "gf",   color = "black",   linewidth = 0.1 ) +   viridis::scale_fill_viridis(option = "plasma", direction = 1) gg_state out_data |>    dplyr::mutate(gf = round(gf,4)) |>    dplyr::rename(     `State` = region,     `Census Region` = census_region,     `FIPS` = fips,     `Population-Adjusted Genotypic Frequency` = gf   ) |>   DT::datatable(     ,filter = 'top'     ,rownames = FALSE     ,extensions = 'Buttons', options = list(       scrollX=TRUE,       pageLength = 10,       dom = 'Bfrtip',       buttons = c('csv', 'excel')       )     )

code: state_frequencies <- CensusHLA::census_adjusted_nmdp_hla_frequencies_by_state |> dplyr::filter(allele == 'A*11:01')  out_data <- state_frequencies |>   dplyr::ungroup() |>   dplyr::group_by(region, census_region, fips) |>   dplyr::summarize(gf = sum(us_2020_nmdp_gf)) ## `summarise()` has grouped output by 'region', 'census_region'. You can override ## using the `.groups` argument. gg_state <- usmap::plot_usmap(   data = out_data,   regions = "states",   #exclude = c('Alaksa','Hawaii'),   exclude = c('AK', 'HI'),   values = "gf",   color = "black",   linewidth = 0.1 ) +   viridis::scale_fill_viridis(option = "plasma", direction = 1) gg_state out_data |>    dplyr::mutate(gf = round(gf,4)) |>    dplyr::rename(     `State` = region,     `Census Region` = census_region,     `FIPS` = fips,     `Population-Adjusted Genotypic Frequency` = gf   ) |>   DT::datatable(     ,filter = 'top'     ,rownames = FALSE     ,extensions = 'Buttons', options = list(       scrollX=TRUE,       pageLength = 10,       dom = 'Bfrtip',       buttons = c('csv', 'excel')       )     )

title: CensusHLA
text: code summary statistics used Roy2025, please refer vignette("Roy 2025 Figures tables")

title: CensusHLA
text: Import process HLA frequency data external sources, specifically Gragert et al. (2013) hosted NMDP. Import process spatial data US Census Bureau, including shapefiles demographic data. “US 2020 Census” (n.d.) via Recht (2017). Calculate HLA allele frequencies various geographic levels (e.g., state, county, catchment). Generate visualizations HLA allele distributions across geographic regions. Integrate HLA data US Census spatial DelNero et al. (2022) demographic data.

title: CensusHLA
text: begin using package, either make sure system requirements, install within provided Docker container. setting system requirements, clone source code github begin add necessary source data described .

title: CensusHLA
text: package tested using [rocker/verse:latest] Docker container R 4.4.3, along additional system-level dependencies. Functions plot frequencies using US maps shapefiles may require following R packages: sf, h3jsr, rnaturalearth, usmap.

title: CensusHLA
text: simplify setup, pre-configured Dockerfile provided inst/extdata/. Build Docker container : building, can start Posit Workbench server using docker-compose.yml file directory: Access server http://localhost:8787 username rstudio password password.
code: sudo docker build -t custom-rocker-verse . docker-compose up

title: CensusHLA
text: access US Census data, need API key. Follow instructions obtain key. Add key ~/.Renviron file manually using usethis::edit_r_environ().

title: CensusHLA
text: Download HLA-, HLA-B, HLA-C frequency data site. Place downloaded .xlsx files inst/extdata/ directory.

title: CensusHLA
text: automate setup process, use inst/scripts/initiate_package_with_external_data.R script. script checks required files runs necessary scripts correct order:. NB - Due connection timeouts US Census servers, may need re-run script multiple times.

title: CensusHLA
text: automated setup script work, can manually prepare data files. Catchment Spatial Files: Run data-raw/import_delNero2024_catchment.R. 2 Census Spatial Files: Run data-raw/import_census2020_tiger_shapefiles.R. Note downloading large shapefiles may take time (~30 minutes). Import Gragert 2013 Files: Run data-raw/import_gragert2013_data.R. data-raw/nmdp_racegroups.R: Creates data object NMDP race groups. data-raw/valid_state_names.R: Generates vector valid state names. data-raw/us_pop_multirace_in_nmdp_codes.R: Retrieves US-wide population estimates. data-raw/nmdp_hla_frequencies_us_2020_census_adjusted.R: Generates US-wide HLA frequency estimates. data-raw/census_adjusted_nmdp_hla_frequencies_by_state.R: Prepares state-level HLA frequency data. data-raw/census_adjusted_nmdp_hla_frequencies_by_county.R: Prepares county-level HLA frequency data. default, top 20 abundant HLAs included. script may take significant time run.

title: CensusHLA
text: Provide examples use package common tasks, visualizing HLA allele distributions integrating external datasets.
code: library(CensusHLA) state_frequencies <- CensusHLA::census_adjusted_nmdp_hla_frequencies_by_state |> dplyr::filter(allele == 'A*11:01')  out_data <- state_frequencies |>   dplyr::ungroup() |>   dplyr::group_by(region, census_region, fips) |>   dplyr::summarize(gf = sum(us_2020_nmdp_gf))  gg_state <- usmap::plot_usmap(   data = out_data,   regions = "states",   #exclude = c('Alaksa','Hawaii'),   exclude = c('AK', 'HI'),   values = "gf",   color = "black",   linewidth = 0.1 ) +   viridis::scale_fill_viridis(option = "plasma", direction = 1)  gg_state

title: Authors and Citation
text: Christian Roy. Author, maintainer. Ileana Saenz. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Roy C (2025). “CensusHLA.” NA, NA(NA), NA. https://github.com/Affini-T-Tx/CensusHLA.
code: @Article{,   title = {CensusHLA},   author = {Chris Roy},   journal = {NA},   year = {2025},   volume = {NA},   number = {NA},   pages = {NA},   url = {https://github.com/Affini-T-Tx/CensusHLA}, }

what: CensusHLA - a package to map US HLA Frequency data by region
title: CensusHLA - a package to map US HLA Frequency data by region
text: Please refer Github pages (pkgdown) Documentation get started, Refer summary data used generate Figures Tables Roy2025. CensusHLA R package designed facilitate analysis HLA allele frequencies across United States using census data external datasets. package provides tools importing, processing, visualizing HLA frequency data, well integrating spatial demographic information. particularly useful researchers working population genetics, immunogenetics, public health. *11:01 GF San Francisco Census Tract

title: CensusHLA - a package to map US HLA Frequency data by region
text: Contributions welcome! Please submit issues pull requests via GitHub.

title: CensusHLA - a package to map US HLA Frequency data by region
text: project licensed AGPLv2 License. See LICENSE.md file details.

title: CensusHLA - a package to map US HLA Frequency data by region
text: Gragert et al. (2013) HLA frequency data. Gragert et al. (2013) US Census Bureau spatial demographic data. “US 2020 Census” (n.d.) censusapi R package Recht (2017) accessing census data. NCI awesome cancer catchment data. DelNero et al. (2022) sf, h3jsr, rnaturalearth, usmap packages spatial data handling visualization.

what: Calculate country census tract allele frequencies — calculate_country_census_tract_allele_frequencies
title: Calculate country census tract allele frequencies — calculate_country_census_tract_allele_frequencies
text: function calculates allele frequencies census tract across states country. aggregates data individual states combines unified result.

title: Calculate country census tract allele frequencies — calculate_country_census_tract_allele_frequencies
Calculate country census tract allele frequencies — calculate_country_census_tract_allele_frequencies
text: query_allele character string representing allele frequencies calculated.

title: Calculate country census tract allele frequencies — calculate_country_census_tract_allele_frequencies
text: list containing following elements: us_population_race_code_percentages_by_tract: data frame allele frequencies census tract across states. sf_tract_data_for_all_states: data frame spatial additional data census tract across states.

title: Calculate country census tract allele frequencies — calculate_country_census_tract_allele_frequencies

what: Calculate a NMDP Genotypic Frequency Table by Census Tracts within a State — calculate_county_census_tract_allele_frequencies
title: Calculate a NMDP Genotypic Frequency Table by Census Tracts within a State — calculate_county_census_tract_allele_frequencies
text: function calculates genotypic frequency table specified HLA allele census tracts within given state, adjusted 2020 Census population data. also provides shapefile visualization.

title: Calculate a NMDP Genotypic Frequency Table by Census Tracts within a State — calculate_county_census_tract_allele_frequencies
Calculate a NMDP Genotypic Frequency Table by Census Tracts within a State — calculate_county_census_tract_allele_frequencies
text: state_abbreviation two-letter postal code representing state. query_allele HLA allele analyzed plotted NMDP data.

title: Calculate a NMDP Genotypic Frequency Table by Census Tracts within a State — calculate_county_census_tract_allele_frequencies
text: list containing: us_population_race_code_percentages data frame population percentages race codes. nmdp_freq_subset data frame adjusted genotypic frequencies specified allele. sf_data Spatial data (shapefile) state's census tracts. shapefile_path file path shapefile used.

title: get_all_state_info_by_census_tract — get_all_state_info_by_census_tract
text: Retrieves census tract information maps states United States. function queries state codes, iterates state, retrieves corresponding census tract information map. error occurs process, caught logged,

title: get_all_state_info_by_census_tract — get_all_state_info_by_census_tract

what: Get Census Tract Information and Map by State — get_census_tract_info_and_map_by_state
title: Get Census Tract Information and Map by State — get_census_tract_info_and_map_by_state

what: Obtain US Census-adjusted nmdp Alleleic Frequencies by Region — obtain_census_adjusted_nmdp_hla_frequencies_by_region
title: Obtain US Census-adjusted nmdp Alleleic Frequencies by Region — obtain_census_adjusted_nmdp_hla_frequencies_by_region
text: Obtain US Census-adjusted nmdp Alleleic Frequencies Region

title: Obtain US Census-adjusted nmdp Alleleic Frequencies by Region — obtain_census_adjusted_nmdp_hla_frequencies_by_region
Obtain US Census-adjusted nmdp Alleleic Frequencies by Region — obtain_census_adjusted_nmdp_hla_frequencies_by_region
text: in_region string either 'us', 'states' (useful), valid state name like 'Alaska' region_level string either 'state' 'county' - default 'state'

title: Obtain US Census-adjusted nmdp Alleleic Frequencies by Region — obtain_census_adjusted_nmdp_hla_frequencies_by_region
text: Data Frame US Census Adjusted HLA Alleleic Frequencies allele - Allele question is_g - trailing g alleles include inclusive multiple alleles ( see Maiers2007 details) nmdp_race_code - Value used nmdp denote races studies nmdp_af - Allelic frequency measured nmdp within race nmdp_calc_gf - Genotypic frequency calculated righ toff allelic frequency using hardy-weinburg region - used downstream tables denote regions - US census_region - function used function call US 2020 census data can adjusted states - state chosen put total_2020_pop - total population given region us_2020_percent_pop - percentage overall population given nmdp code given region. sum close 1 specific HLA Allele us_2020_nmdp_gf - US-Census race-adjusted genotypic frequency value - used downstream applications

title: Obtain US Census-adjusted nmdp Alleleic Frequencies by Region — obtain_census_adjusted_nmdp_hla_frequencies_by_region
text: relies preprocessing performed 'preprocessing/nmdpFrequencies.Rmd'

title: Obtain US Census-adjusted nmdp Alleleic Frequencies by Region — obtain_census_adjusted_nmdp_hla_frequencies_by_region
code: obtain_census_adjusted_nmdp_hla_frequencies_by_region(in_region = 'Alaska') #> # A tibble: 11,705 × 12 #>    region loci  allele   is_g nmdp_race_code nmdp_af nmdp_calc_gf fips  #>    <chr>  <chr> <chr>   <dbl> <chr>            <dbl>        <dbl> <chr> #>  1 us     A     A*02:01     1 CAU             0.272         0.469 02    #>  2 us     A     A*01:01     1 CAU             0.159         0.292 02    #>  3 us     C     C*07:01     1 CAU             0.155         0.286 02    #>  4 us     A     A*03:01     1 CAU             0.140         0.260 02    #>  5 us     C     C*07:02     1 CAU             0.137         0.254 02    #>  6 us     B     B*07:02     1 CAU             0.125         0.234 02    #>  7 us     C     C*04:01     1 CAU             0.115         0.217 02    #>  8 us     B     B*08:01     1 CAU             0.106         0.200 02    #>  9 us     C     C*06:02     1 CAU             0.0951        0.181 02    #> 10 us     A     A*24:02     1 CAU             0.0891        0.170 02    #> # ℹ 11,695 more rows #> # ℹ 4 more variables: census_region <chr>, total_2020_pop <dbl>, #> #   us_2020_percent_pop <dbl>, us_2020_nmdp_gf <dbl>

title: Summarize Tract Genotypic Frequencies by delNero2022 Catchment — summarize_tract_genotypic_frequencies_by_delNero2022_catchment

title: Summarize Tract Genotypic Frequencies by delNero2022 Catchment — summarize_tract_genotypic_frequencies_by_delNero2022_catchment
text: Imports nmdp data query allele. Checks values nmdp data. Calculates nmdp frequencies census tract states. Imports delNero2022 catchment areas formats appropriately. Pulls state geographic area including tract data centroids. Joins delNero2022 catchment areas tract centroids. Joins nmdp info tract tract geographic info. Summarizes nmdp data per catchment area based tract data. Returns list multiple objects including summarized data.

title: US Population by Multi-Race in NMDP Codes — us_pop_multirace_in_nmdp_codes

title: US Population by Multi-Race in NMDP Codes — us_pop_multirace_in_nmdp_codes
text: nmdp_race_code NMDP race code. total_single_race_pop Total population identifying race according 2020 Census. total_multiple_race_pop Total population identifying multiple races, adjusted fractionally. example, person identifying two races contributes 0.5 race's count. total_2020_pop Total 2020 Census population, including single-race multi-race individuals. nmdp_race_code nmdp race code total_single_race_pop Total individates identifying race according 2020 census total_multiple_race_pop individuates identifying multiple races, fractional persons added count. person identifying 2 races divded 2, 0.5 added corresponding race count, 3,4, races. total_2020_pop Total 2020 census population (including single multi-races identifying individuals)

title: Obtain US Population Numbers by NMDP Race Codes and Region — us_pop_multirace_in_nmdp_codes_by_region
Obtain US Population Numbers by NMDP Race Codes and Region — us_pop_multirace_in_nmdp_codes_by_region
text: in_region string specifying region interest. Valid values : "us" - Entire United States "states" - states (recommended use) "counties" - counties valid state name (e.g., "Alaska") census_region_level string specifying granularity data: "state" - Data divided state (default) "county" - Data divided county within state

title: Obtain US Population Numbers by NMDP Race Codes and Region — us_pop_multirace_in_nmdp_codes_by_region
text: data frame containing population numbers NMDP race codes region, following columns: region - specified region (e.g., state county) nmdp_race_code - NMDP race code total_single_race_pop - Population reporting single race total_multiple_race_pop - Population reporting multiple races total_2020_pop - Total population (single + multiple race) census_region - Census region corresponding input region
